channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024060416
item.description:
Report X-2024060416

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-10T18:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It has been brought to our attention that a package was found to be leaking at the unload side. As a precautionary measure, the package was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. Upon examination, it was discovered that the content had a loose cap, leading to a leakage that spread across the other bottles

item.title: Report X-2024051713
item.description:
Report X-2024051713

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-10T18:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-28
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Damaged package left in a tote at NASH 371 HWPA. Inspection found that twelve 32-ounce plastic bottles of Purell Foodservice Surface Sanitizer leaked due to loose caps. This shipment received a DPR, repack and RTS at MEML-386. Repack was shipped without a diamond label or other hazmat markings. No DGNav report or ISF was completed at the time of DPR. The original package also appears to have been undeclared.

item.title: Report X-2024060250
item.description:
Report X-2024060250

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-10T18:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-24
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 24th a drum was discovered leaking during the AM sort. The drum contained UN1866, RESIN SOLUTION, 3, II and was leaking from the chime on the bottom. It was cleaned up, placed into a salvage drum and held pending disposition.

item.title: Report X-2024060249
item.description:
Report X-2024060249

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-10T18:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-18
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/18/2024 at approximately 0530, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 355827 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a gasoline spill. The shipment consisted by 2 glass bottles packaged in a fiberboard box. The spill was due to complete leakage of both bottles, resulting in total loss. The cause of the spillage is unknown. The shipment is being disposed of as hazardous waste.

item.title: Report X-2024051572
item.description:
Report X-2024051572

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-07T18:15:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-23
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH facility a fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered. Packaged inside of the fiberboard box were plastic barrier bags containing UN2922 with air bags for dunnage. Of the the barrier bags was damaged causing the release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
